summary: Indian Health Service provides health care to 2.6 million American Indians and Alaskan Natives. Outdated facilities, few inpatient beds, and health care provider shortages make IHS's pandemic response especially challenging. IHS took steps to mitigate these challenges by using its $9 billion in COVID-19 relief funding to address immediate and longstanding needs, e.g., covering vaccine- and testing-related costs and implementing a video telehealth system. IHS...
title: Indian Health Service: Relief Funding and Agency Response to COVID-19 Pandemic
